body:
@selvaganesang 
As my understand, you concern is about how to determine the the number of bytes for length, 2 bytes or 4 bytes. 
Actually, we have a descriptor item names vc_ind_length to indicate using 2 or 4 bytes for length. However, now the client can't get vc_ind_length from server. The same solution was already in JDBC client. 

If we want to modify the protocol between client and server to support vc_ind_length, we need modify both JDBC, linux ODBC and windows ODBC.  I preferred to create anther JIRA to do it.

Hi @traflm, thanks for the great comments. I think I've addressed them. Please review.

Regarding TO_CHAR, could you write a JIRA? Feel free to assign to me.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/1456/

A general comment.
Format values that have date fields in them are part of TO_DATE function.
For example:  
 to_date('01.03.2016 10.11.12', 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24.MI.SS') is a valid construct.

Currently we accept date and time format syntax for both to_date and to_time functions.
Some of it is for backward compatibility.

For clarity, we can fix our code to accept:
  format values with date field in them for TO_DATE
  format values without date field for TO_TIME

One other place to see examples of supported date/time functions
is regress/seabase/TEST030.

Ah, OK. So, TO_TIME should always be just TIMEs, while TO_DATE may be DATE or TIMESTAMP (depending on whether the hours etc. fields are specified). I'll change the documentation accordingly and fix the code as well.

The latest rework does the following:

1. Restricts TO_DATE to formats that include year, month and/or day fields. Restricts TO_TIME to formats that include only hour, minute or second fields.
2. Fixes four bugs:
a. When an invalid day was given (e.g. March 33), the source data was missing from the 8415 error message.
b. Time fields were not validated in either TO_DATE or TO_TIME. Now they are: An 8415 error is reported for an invalid time field.
c. Date values having the MON format would result in 8810 errors if the month was not recognized. Now an 8415 error will be reported. (Example: values(to_date('04-DEC-2016','DDMONYYYY')); -- note the unwanted hyphens in the data value.)
d. An error path in method ex_function_dateformat::eval tried to report an executor internal error (8001) if a datetime conversion routine returned an error but without reporting a diagnostic. If no diagsArea object had been allocated, the error path would fail to report the 8001 error, instead resulting in an 8810 error.
@traflm and @anoopsharma00, could you take a look at the latest rework? Thanks.
This pull request didn't get reported in the JIRA. Maybe because Trafodion was spelled out in lower case? You might want to manually add a link from the JIRA to this pull request.
The failed test is TEST042, it's not related to this change. So I think extra test is passed.

This is a very cool feature. I just check the TEST022, it is exactly what we are looking forwarding. Need some time to read the changes, this is a big change.
One thing to be clarify: what kind of encode/decode to access the data in native hbase table?
TEST042 fail doesn't due to this change. So this is ready to merge for me. +1
If no one has any more comments, I'm going to merge this.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/1471/

Response to encode/decode question.

Column values in native hbase table can be stored in string format or in native
format (this is when data is stored in native format of datatype. For ex,
an integer is stored as 4-byte value).

Values stored in string format (for ex, integer 12345 is stored as
a string of length 5 : "12345") . These values are read as is and then
interpreted depending on the mapped table definition.

When creating external table mapped to hbase table, one can specify
whether the native format value is serialized or not.  
If data is serialized, then it will be unserialized (or
decoded) during read. This is same behavior to when
a trafodion table is created and column definitions are specified.

When writing to native hbase table, data will be serialized/encoded if needed.

This looks good to me. +1
Can we merge it now? @venkat1m
See  JIRA [TRAFODION-2314] for details about the behavior of a sample program with and without -lpthread

-1

This is a very specialized solution to the connect by problem and I don't think we should put such a narrowly defined SPJ into Trafodion, where people would expect a more general solution.

Please understand that the SPJ shown here is good, it solves a real problem. I just feel that we need to have a more general solution as a built-in function in Trafodion. It would be good if others could comment on that as well.

Here are some of the limitations I think we should try to avoid:

- The column structure for recursing is fixed, only a single VARCHAR(100) not null column is supported. Many use cases will need different data types and/or multiple columns.
- The "root query" is hard-coded, in many cases a different root query will be required. Example: List all the employees of a manager who is not at the root of the hierarchy.
- As far as I can tell, the SPJ discards all the root nodes except the last.
- The SPJ stores an in-memory table instead of using SQL. This is not scalable and does not use parallelism in the way a user would expect of Trafodion.
- The SPJ does not support a maximum level of recursion, cycle detection, or the ability to record the recursion level or other aggregates.
- There are no comments in the SPJ, making it hard to read.

What about a much more general SPJ that takes the following arguments:

- The name of a table, partially populated with an initial set of data.
- An SQL query that iterates over this table, computing one level of recursion. The query has an optional input parameter ('%1$s'), which is the level.
- The maximum number of levels to iterate.
- An optional query that executes a test whether iteration is complete. If not specified, iteration stops when the maximum number of levels is reached, an error occurs, or when the iteration inserts no new records.
- An optional SQL query that is executed after the iteration is complete. If not specified, the caller of the SPJ can issue their own query to retrieve the results.

Such an SPJ would avoid all the problems I listed above. It could scale to very large data sets and it could use parallelism.
What about putting this SPJ into the [Trafodion Code Examples](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TRAFODION/Trafodion+Code+Examples) wiki so people can use and modify it?

I did a little web-surfing and found an example of pthread_mutex_unlock returning EPERM. Perhaps this might give some insight into your issue? That said, your code changes look fine.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7422316/how-do-you-handle-pthread-mutex-unlock-failures

Thanks @DaveBirIdsall  I did come across this link when I did some research on this issue too. I ran check PR jobs to confirm if I would hit the issue with jdbc_test_cdh again  and I didn't. Though it doesn't conclude this change is indeed the fix for the EPERM issue, I will merge this change in.

This change is definitely very helpful.  Is the change in java/org/trafodion/ci/ConsoleReader.java alone sufficient to take care of history cmd?  If so, can you please add some description for other changes.
It will be a good choice to put this code into the Wiki. I agree with Hans.

the most important change is in java/org/trafodion/ci/ConsoleReader.java, and the change in java/org/trafodion/ci/Session.java is help to remove duplicates the prompt.
other changes are help to pass compile and deploy trafci.

pom.xml & installer_pom.xml : add dependence of jline and format it(replace tab to 4 blanks).
install_jar.xml : add the related jar into the lib folder, and package them together
makefile : add clean part
build.xml : let it work
Installer.java-tmpl : help to do deployment
Thanks @mashengchen for your explanation.  Please consider adding all other issues fixed in the JIRA too. +1 Looks good

failed at TEST042 which is irrelevant, it is good to merge. This will fix the regression test error due to parser change before. 
+1
